CE01.name: Auction Squad
CE01.detail_description:
Round 1 :-

--> Simple Quiz Test (Technologies and basic programming)

->  PPT will be shown on projector and there will be a quizmaster for reading and explaining all questions (Technologies and basic programming)

-> Total marks 50 

-> This round will be approx 20 minutes.

Round 2 :-

         -> Puzzles to earn tokens.

         -> Tokens will be earned on the basis of time completion of the puzzle (both the players will earn individually and it will be added at the end) with the total earned tokens will conduct an auction.

  • 2 programming languages, 2 programs and extra time will be auctioned
  • This round will be of 30 minutes.

Round 3:-

  • Now with the earned language and program both will have to code to complete the final round.
  • There will be swapping within the players of the same team after 5 mins and they'll continue coding each other’s code. (extra time can be used by them during swapping or at the end).
  • Extra time if left unused will be added to their scores.
CE01.coordinator:
Manali Shah - 9408275070
Dewanshi Yadav - 7096691638

CE02.name: The Hunter
CE02.detail_description:
Round 1 :-

  • First round is supposed to be an onpaper event where the participants will be required to solve certain amount of questions that'll lead them to the destination of their second round.

Round 2 :-

  • Second round would be conducted in labs where each team would be assigned a pc(each team gets one), there they'll get certain puzzles and questions that'll again lead them to their 3rd round location preferable outside the CE/ IT building.

Round 3 :-

  • After reaching the third-round location, they'll solve a puzzle that'll be given to them by a volunteer who'll be present there.
  • The order in which the teams returns with the correct answers to the coordinators determines the winner.
CE02.coordinator:
Parin Modi - 9624242247
Pooja Patel - 9601477882

IT01.name: Techno-Geek
IT01.detail_description:
Ultimate pro in computers are people having the triple tackle minds, The participant wins only because of overall knowledge of hardware, software and designing.

Round 1 :- 

  • Hardware quiz, 20 questions, 30mins, moderate to difficult questions on hardware.

Round 2 :-  

  • Coding problem/ OS related questions (optional).

Round 3 :-

  • Designing challenge, using any platform like html, swing(java) to make the most user friendly page.

IT02.name: Code-A-Thon (Hardcore Programing Event)
IT02.detail_description:
• Two rounds of coding problems.
  • A a mind sport in which involving participants trying to program according to provided specifications.
  • Problem is set of logical or mathematical problems to the contestants.
  • Contestants are required to write computer programs capable of solving each problem.
  • Judging is based mostly upon number of problems solved and time spent for writing successful solutions, but may also include other factors (quality of output produced, execution time, program size, etc.)

EC01.name: Flash N Dash
EC01.detail_description:
Task :

Design and construct a remote controlled robot capable of fighting a one on one tournament.

Specifications:

Dimensions and Fabrications:

The machine should fit in a  box of dimension 750mm x 750mm x 1000 mm ( l x b x h) at any given point during the match. The external device used to control the machine or any external task is not included in the size constraint.

The machine should not exceed 58.967 kg (130 pounds) and should be more than 22.6796 kg(50pounds) of weight including the weight of pneumatic source/tank. All pneumatic tanks/source and batteries should be on board. Weight or remove controller will not be counted.

Team Specification:

Any team can participate in Real Steel, Cognizance 2017 may consist of a maximum of 6 participants. These participants can be from or different institutes.

Team Name:

Every team must have a name which must be unique. Cognizance 2017 reserves the right to reject any Team whose name it deems inappropriate, offensive of conflicting. Organizers must be notified during if a Team’s name has been changed.

Team Representative:

Each team must specify their Team Representative (Leader) at the time of registration. All important communications between Cognizance 2017 and the registered team will be done through their team representatives. The team representatives must submit valid contact details (Phone number, Email ID, etc) at the time of registration.
EC01.coordinator:
Shubham Patel - 9033365415
Neel Bhatt - 8460927255

EC02.name: Real Steel
EC02.detail_description:
Task :

  • Design and construct a remote controlled robot capable of fighting a one on one tournament.

Specifications:

Dimensions and Fabrications:

  • The machine should fit in a  box of dimension 750mm x 750mm x 1000 mm ( l x b x h) at any given point during the match.
  • The external device used to control the machine or any external task is not included in the size constraint.
  • The machine should not exceed 58.967 kg (130 pounds) and should be more than 22.6796 kg(50pounds) of weight including the weight of pneumatic source/tank.
  • All pneumatic tanks/source and batteries should be on board.
  • Weight or remove controller will not be counted.

Team Specification:

  • Any team can participate in Real Steel, Cognizance 2017 may consist of a maximum of 6 participants. These participants can be from or different institutes.

Team Name:

  • Every team must have a name which must be unique.
  • Cognizance 2017 reserves the right to reject any Team whose name it deems inappropriate, offensive of conflicting.
  • Organizers must be notified during if a Team’s name has been changed.

Team Representative:

  • All important communications between Cognizance 2017 and the registered team will be done through their team representatives.
  • The team representatives must submit valid contact details (Phone number, Email ID, etc) at the time of registration.

CE03.name: <Spiderman/>
CE03.detail_description:
ROUND 1 :- 

  • In this round, there will be a single member for a particular task and two tasks I total. 
  • One is to identify as many number of superimposed logos as possible which will be a buzzer round i.e. there will only be a single member to identify a particular logo. 
  • Points will be added accordingly. 
  • Whereas the other task is to design a simple code of html in minimum number of time. 
  • One to finish it first will be awarded more points and then so on. 
  • Points of both the tasks will be added at the end. 

ROUND 2 :- 

  • They will be provided, in the second round, with some design or animation which they have to code using html and CSS.
  • Points will be awarded based on timing and perfection. 

ROUND 3 :- 

  • In this round, every team will be provided with a diagram depicting a digital signal generated by using Manchester or any such technique. 
  • Decoding that in binary to decimal and then to ASCII will give them a theme which they need to design into a web page/s using html and CSS.
CE03.coordinator:
Jeel Bhalodia - 9712963779
Megha Makwana - 9408259269

CE04.name: #Coder<Strange.h>
CE04.detail_description:
Round 1 :-

  • This round will be kind of an entertaining round where one team member will be made to listen songs with headphones on and that team member has to interpret what the other team member is trying to tell him.
  • The other team member will be given a chit on which technical words will be written.
  • He/she will be lipping or acting to convey the word.

Round 2:-

  • Here in this round the teams will be given 2 problems of reverse coding (i.e. only input and output will be given and no problem statement or description will be given) to solve in 45 minutes and along with that there will be a surprise rapid-fire round while the participants will be coding.

Round 3:-

  • This round will be of 30 minutes.
  • In this round, one participant will be made to solve the problem given and other participant will be made to solve a Sudoku problem at different place from the first participant.
  • After 15 mins both participants will be swapped.

IT03.name: Mobile App Mockup
IT03.detail_description:
Participants are supposed to build a small live project to solve a problem with a sustainable way.

Round 1:

  • Present the solution of the problem and also explain various parameters like technology used and feasibility.

Round 2:

  • Build the small prototype or minimum viable product and present it.

IT04.name: Programmer 's Date
IT04.detail_description:
ROUND 1(Meet & Greet) :-

  • A Set of MCQ and Crossword technical puzzle.
  • The Top 30 would be advanced to Round 2. According to the score in the round 1.
  • The participants would be made in group.
  • Every participant would be made in group with either girl or boy accordingly.

Round 2 (Know The Surrounding) :-

  • This round is same as you played your childhood game Name, Place ,Animal , Thing. In this round one partner picks up the cheat which is full of Letters A-Z . And the other participant has to write Accordingly the Keyword, Android App, IT Company starting from that Letter.
  • Each correct word will be of 1 mark.
  • Top 8 would be advanced to Round 3.

Round 3 (Together Forever) :-

  • This round would be the buzzer round the team which answers more questions wins.
